intro: Polianthes debilis, commonly known as the Mexican rain lily, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in gardens. Polianthes debilis is also known for its ability to bloom reliably when provided with the right growing conditions.
